sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词或动词均可表示"邮件，邮寄"之意。
这些名词均有"职位"之意。
means: place ： 指任何不分高低贵贱的职位；有时侧重指在政府、法庭所谋求的职位。
position ： 侧重指社会地位较高，工作较为庄重，领取工资的职位。
post ： 普通用词，指人的职务，职位，岗位。
situation ： 正式用词，一般指雇员或为富有人家工作所担任的职位，现多见于广告中。

word_mean: 柱：牢固的直立物体，通常用作支持物
post-industrial society 又称“工业化后社会”。
post-glacial climate  晚更新世冰期结束之后的温暖气候。一般指10[KG*4]000—11[KG*4]000年以前开始至今的全新世气候。
post-arc current  又称“剩余电流”。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 让某人了解最新进展；为某人提供最新消息

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, from Latin postis 'doorpost', later 'rod, beam', probably reinforced in Middle English by Old French post 'pillar, beam' and Middle Dutch, Middle Low German post 'doorpost'
early 16th cent. (in sense 2 of the noun): from French poste, from Italian posta, from a contraction of Latin posita, feminine past participle of ponere 'to place'
mid 16th cent.: from French poste, from Italian posto, from a contraction of popular Latin positum, neuter past participle of ponere 'to place'

encyclopedia.content: PB中的postPost()定义 功能将指定消息加入到某个窗口的消息队列中，这个窗口既可以是PowerBuilder应用的窗口，也可以是其它应用的窗口。语法 语法Post( handle, messageno, word, long )参数 参数handle：long类型，指定窗口的系统句柄，将向该窗口邮寄消息messageno：UnsignedInteger类型，指定要邮寄的消息号 word：long类型，指定与消息一起邮寄的word类参数值。如果messageno参数指定的消息不使用该参数，那么将这个参数的值

entry.def: The post is the public service or system by which letters and packages are collected and delivered.

example.ex: You'll receive your book through the post...
example.tran: 书会邮递给你。

example.ex: The winner will be notified by post...
example.tran: 获胜者将以邮件形式通知。

entry.def: You can use post to refer to letters and packages that are delivered to you.

example.ex: He flipped through the post without opening any of it...
example.tran: 他飞快地翻了一下邮件，但一封也没有打开。

example.ex: There has been no post in three weeks.
example.tran: 3个星期都没有邮件。

entry.def: Post is used to refer to an occasion when letters or packages are delivered. For example, first post on a particular day is the first time that things are delivered.

example.ex: Entries must arrive by first post next Wednesday...
example.tran: 参赛作品必须在下周三第一批邮件之前寄达。

example.ex: They just have to wait patiently for the next post.
example.tran: 他们只好耐心地等下一批邮件。

entry.def: If you post a letter or package, you send it to someone by putting it in a post box or by taking it to a post office.

example.ex: If I write a letter, would you post it for me?...
example.tran: 如果我写封信，你能替我寄出去吗？

example.ex: I'm posting you a cheque tonight...
example.tran: 我今晚会给你寄支票。

entry.def: If you post notices, signs, or other pieces of information somewhere, you fix them to a wall or board so that everyone can see them.

example.ex: Officials began posting warning notices...
example.tran: 官员们开始张贴警告。

example.ex: She has posted photographs on bulletin boards.
example.tran: 她已把照片贴在了公告牌上。

entry.def: If you post information on the Internet, you make the information available to other people on the Internet.

example.ex: A consultation paper has been posted on the Internet inviting input from Net users.
example.tran: 一份征询意见书已贴在了因特网上，欢迎网络用户发表意见。

entry.tran: 向…提供最新信息；使及时了解
entry.def: If you keep someone posted, you keep giving them the latest information about a situation that they are interested in.

example.ex: Keep me posted on your progress.
example.tran: 让我随时了解你们的进展。

entry.def: A post in a company or organization is a job or official position in it, usually one that involves responsibility.

example.ex: She had earlier resigned her post as President Menem's assistant...
example.tran: 她早些时候辞去了梅内姆总统助理一职。

example.ex: Sir Peter has held several senior military posts.
example.tran: 彼得爵士担任过几个高级军事职务。

entry.def: If you are posted somewhere, you are sent there by the organization that you work for and usually work there for several years.

example.ex: After training she was posted to Brixton...
example.tran: 培训结束后她被派往布里克斯顿。

example.ex: It is normal to spend two or three years working in this country before being posted overseas.
example.tran: 被派往海外之前，通常会在这个国家工作两三年。

entry.def: You can use post to refer to the place where a soldier, guard, or other person has been told to remain and to do his or her job.

example.ex: Quick men, back to your post!
example.tran: 迅速返回各自岗位！

entry.def: If a soldier, guard, or other person is posted somewhere, they are told to stand there, in order to supervise an activity or guard a place.

example.ex: Police have now been posted outside all temples...
example.tran: 现在所有神殿外都已安排警察站岗。

example.ex: British Rail had to post a signalman at the entrance to the tunnel...
example.tran: 英国铁路公司不得不在隧道入口设置了一名信号员。

entry.def: A post is a strong upright pole made of wood or metal that is fixed into the ground.

example.ex: You have to get eight wooden posts, and drive them into the ground...
example.tran: 你得找来8根木桩，并把它们敲入地里。

example.ex: The device is fixed to a post.
example.tran: 这个装置被固定在杆子上。

entry.def: A post is the same as a goalpost .

example.ex: Wimbledon were unlucky not to win after hitting the post twice.
example.tran: 温布尔登队运气不佳，两次将球踢到门柱上，最终没有获胜。

entry.def: On a horse-racing track, the post is a pole which marks the finishing point.

means.word_mean: 1. the position where someone (as a guard or sentry) stands or is assigned to stand;
2. military installation at which a body of troops is stationed;

sentences.sentence: "this military post provides an important source of income for the town nearby"
"there is an officer's club on the post"
"he occupied a post in the treasury"

means.word_mean: 4. an upright consisting of a piece of timber or metal fixed firmly in an upright position;

sentences.sentence: "he set a row of posts in the ground and strung barbwire between them"

means.word_mean: 5. any particular collection of letters or packages that is delivered;
6. a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track);

sentences.sentence: "a pair of posts marked the goal"
"the corner of the lot was indicated by a stake"

means.word_mean: 7. the system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office;

sentences.sentence: "the mail handles billions of items every day"
"he works for the United States mail service"

means.word_mean: 8. the delivery and collection of letters and packages;

sentences.sentence: "if you hurry you'll catch the post"

means.word_mean: 1. affix in a public place or for public notice;
2. publicize with, or as if with, a poster;

sentences.sentence: "I'll post the news on the bulletin board"

means.word_mean: 3. assign to a post; put into a post;
5. display, as of records in sports games
7. transfer (entries) from one account book to another
8. ride Western style and bob up and down in the saddle in in rhythm with a horse's trotting gait
11. cause to be directed or transmitted to another place;

sentences.sentence: "I'll mail you the paper when it's written"

auth_sentence.content: It's as if post-modernism or punk never happened.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's as if post-modernism or punk never happened.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's as if post-modernism or punk never happened.

auth_sentence.content: The university said Prof Morgan remains in his post.
auth_sentence.res_content: The university said Prof Morgan remains in his post.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The university said Prof Morgan remains in his post.

auth_sentence.content: The prime minister's post is not my priority.
auth_sentence.res_content: The prime minister's post is not my priority.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The prime minister's post is not my priority.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"邮件,邮政"; 2. 表示"在后面"

stems_affixes.word_buile: post邮件,邮政+al……的→adj.邮政的
post在后面+er+ior……的→后面的
post在后面+graduate毕业→n.研究所学生,研究生 adj.大学毕业后的
post在后面+hum土+ous……的→入土表示死→死后的
post在后面+war战争→adj.战后的
post邮件,邮政→n.邮件,邮政 v. 邮递
post邮件,邮政+age费用→n.邮资
post邮件,邮政+card纸片→n.明信片
post邮件,邮政+er表示东西→n.招贴画,驿站
post邮件,邮政+man人→n.邮差
post邮件,邮政+mark记号→n.邮戳
post邮件,邮政+office办公室→n.邮局
post在后面+date日期→v. 填迟……的日期 n. 事后日期
post在后面+er+ity表名词→后面的人→子孙
post在后面+face脸;前面→后面的脸→刊后语
post在后面+graduate毕业→n.研究所学生,研究生 adj.大学毕业后的
post在后面+script写→写在后面的话
post邮件,邮政→n.邮件,邮政 v. 邮递
post在后面+date日期→v. 填迟……的日期 n. 事后日期
post在后面+pone放→放到后面→推迟

In August, when she first realized she had a problem, she posted a message on a Yahoo Internet addiction group with the subject line: "I have an Internet Addiction.
Helen Lee took a 70% cut in salary when she moved from a senior post in Abbott Laboratories to a medical department at the University of Cambridge.
Harry Lewis, noted in a blog post about his objections.
How did Harry Lewis react to Harvard's decision in his blog post

Since then, several academic institutions have begun to require IDPs for post docs And in June, the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH) Biomedical Research Workforce Working Group recommended that the NIH require IDPs for the approximately 32,000 postdoctoral researchers they support.

sentences.en: The post is stalled fast in the ground.
sentences.cn: 那根柱子牢牢地竖在地上。

means.word_mean: (赛马或赛跑用的)起跑标；终点标

sentences.en: The horses galloped towards the post.
There was no end to the letters pouring into the post office.
sentences.cn: 有大量的信投进了邮局。

sentences.en: A letter has come for you in the second post.
sentences.cn: 今天的第二批邮件中有一封你的信。

sentences.en: I've just taken her birthday card down to the post.
sentences.cn: 我刚把她的生日贺卡拿去邮局寄。

sentences.en: Ask him whether he would accept the post.
sentences.cn: 问问他是否愿意就任该职。

sentences.en: I don't think I should be suitable for the post.
sentences.cn: 我认为这个岗位对我不合适。

sentences.en: Post this notice on the wall.
They have posted the ship (as) missing.
sentences.cn: 他们已宣布那艘船失踪。

sentences.en: He posted the letter this morning.
sentences.cn: 他今天上午把信寄出去了。

sentences.en: I posted him a letter yesterday.
sentences.cn: 昨天我给他邮去一封信。

sentences.en: This place was not very safe, so they wanted to post guard.
sentences.cn: 这个地方不太安全, 因此他们想设岗于此。

sentences.en: We posted a guard to keep watch.
sentences.cn: 我们派了一名卫兵站岗。

jushi.english: What they want to know is whether he is capable of holding that important post.
jushi.chinese: 他们想知道的是他是否有能力保住那一重要职位。

jushi.english: Will you take this letter to the post?
jushi.chinese: 你能把这封信带去邮走吗?

jushi.english: He worked neither for fame nor fortune and always fought at his ordinary post.
jushi.chinese: 他不为名、不为利,始终战斗在平凡的岗位上。
